headlines.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a goal and was sent off as Arsenal drew 1-1 against Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Auba scores, sent off in Arsenal draw at Palace

headlines.description: Callum Hudson-Odoi scored his first Premier League goal for Chelsea to cap off a 3-0 victory over Burnley at Stamdford Bridge.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hudson-Odoi nets first Prem goal in Chelsea win

headlines.description: Everton striker Richarlison scored the winner against Brighton & Hove Albion in an important 1-0 victory at Goodison Park on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Richarlison seals Everton win over Brighton

headlines.description: Southampton stunned Leicester City with a 2-1 win at the King Power Stadium on Saturday, as a late goal from Danny Ings and a fortunate strike from
headlines.shortLinkText: Southampton stun Leicester with late Ings wnner

headlines.description: Marcus Rashford scored twice as Manchester United cruised to a comfortable 4-0 victory against Norwich City at Old Trafford on Saturday.

video.headline: Nicol: Man United's midfield still too inconsistent

tracking.trackingName: INET_SOC EPL PD41 (Nicol: Man United's midfield still too inconsistent) 2020/1/11 GLOBAL

headlines.shortLinkText: Rashford double helps United smash Norwich

headlines.description: Europe-chasing Wolverhampton Wanderers were held to a 1-1 draw at home by Newcastle United in the Premier League on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Newcastle hang on for point at Wolves

headlines.description: Liverpool opened up a 16 point gap at the top of the table after a 1-0 win against Tottenham on Saturday.

video.headline: Burley: Liverpool are an unbelievably well-oiled machine

headlines.shortLinkText: Record-setting Liverpool roll on against Spurs
